step1.sentence: I haven't caught a cold all winter — knock on wood!

step2.story: Sarah had been driving the same old car for ten years without a single breakdown. "This thing just keeps running perfectly," she told her friend, tapping the dashboard. "Knock on wood — I don't want to jinx it before my road trip next week."

step3.story: Daniel was three months into his new job and everything was going surprisingly well. His boss praised his reports, his teammates were supportive, and he even got a small raise ahead of schedule. At dinner, his wife asked how work was going. "Honestly, it feels almost too good to be true," he said, grinning nervously. He reached over and tapped the wooden table twice. "Knock on wood — I really don't want anything to ruin this streak." His wife laughed and tapped the table too, just for good measure.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 나무를 두드리다라는 뜻으로, 행운이 계속되기를 바라며 나무를 톡톡 치는 행위를 말합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 좋은 일이 계속되길 바라거나, 불운을 막고 싶을 때 미신적으로 쓰는 표현입니다. 보통 자신에게 좋은 상황을 언급한 직후에 덧붙여서 '징크스 걸리지 않게'라는 뉘앙스로 사용합니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 고대 유럽의 민간 신앙에서 유래했습니다. 나무에 선한 정령이 살고 있어서 나무를 두드리면 악령을 쫓고 행운을 지켜준다고 믿었던 전통에서 비롯되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 진지한 미신이라기보다는 가벼운 관용 표현으로, 유머러스하거나 반쯤 농담조로 쓰이는 경우가 많습니다. 격식 없는 일상 대화에서 자연스럽게 사용됩니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: We haven't had any problems so far, knock on wood.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 지금까지 아무 문제 없었어, 부디 계속 그러길.
